Course Code                                                                                    Unnamed: 0
     Course Title                                                    Major: Web Application Development-I (PHP)
           Credit                                                                    3 (Theory) + 1 (Practical)
     Teaching per                                                              3hrs (Theory) + 2hrs (Practical)
             Week                                                                                           NaN
    Minimum weeks                            15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
     per Semester                                                                                           NaN
    Last Review /                                                                                       2021-22
         Revision                                                                                           NaN
Purpose of Course The purpose of the course is to make students capable of developing professional applications
              NaN                                               using the latest tools and technologies in PHP.
 Course Objective                                                                                 For Students:
              NaN            To Provide the necessary knowledge to design and develop dynamic, database-driven
              NaN                                                                    web applications using PHP
              NaN                                                         Will learn how to use MYSQL database
    Pre-requisite                                                 HTML/XHTML, CSS, JS or equivalent knowledge·
              NaN                                   Other web programming languages knowledge will be helpful.
              NaN                                            Knowledge of Database & basic SQL is recommended.
   Course Outcome                                                                      Students will be able to
              NaN                                                  Carry out Server-side programming using PHP
              NaN                                                     Develop database-driven web applications
              NaN                                          Integrating PHP programs with Client-side scripting
   Course Content                                                      Unit 1: Basic Introduction to PHP[8 Hrs]
              NaN       1.1 Important tools and software requirements (like Web Server, Database, Editors etc.)
              NaN                           1.2 Basic Syntax, PHP variables and constants Types of data in PHP,
              NaN                                             Expressions, scopes of a variable (local, global)
              NaN            1.3 PHP Operators: Arithmetic, Assignment, Relational, Logical operators, Bitwise,
              NaN                          ternary and MOD operators. PHP operator Precedence and associativity
              NaN                                   1.4 PHP IF Else conditional statements (Nested IF and Else)
              NaN                                  1.5 Switch Case, While, For and Do ... While Loop statements
              NaN                                              1.6 Goto, Break, Continue and exit PHP Functions
              NaN                                                                                           NaN
              NaN                                                                  Unit 2: Arrays in PHP[7 Hrs]
              NaN                         2.1 Introduction to Array, creating index based and Associative array
              NaN                          2.2 Accessing array Looping with Index based array, with associative
              NaN                                                             Array using each() and forEach().
              NaN                   2.3 Some Useful array functions: implode, explode, count, different sorting
              NaN                    functions, array_reverse, array_search, array_push, array_pop, array_keys,
              NaN                                                                                  Key, sizeof.
              NaN                                                                                           NaN
              NaN                              Unit 3: String Manipulation and Regular Expression in PHP[6 Hrs]
              NaN                                                             3.1 Creating and accessing String
              NaN                     3.2 Searching & Replacing String formatting, joining and splitting String
              NaN                                                                     Related Library functions
              NaN                    3.3 Use of preg_match(), preg_replace(), preg_split() functions in Regular
              NaN                                                                   Expression for validations.

Unnamed: 0                                                                             Unnamed: 1 Unnamed: 2
              NaN                                     Unit 4: Handling HTML forms with PHP and Database:    [8 Hrs]
              NaN                                4.1 Capturing Form Data using GET and POST form methods        NaN
              NaN                4.1.1 Dealing with multiple values including arrays to redirect data on        NaN
              NaN                                                                          another page.        NaN
              NaN                                     4.1.2 Image / file upload implementation with PHP.        NaN
              NaN               4.2 Dealing with Sessions & Cookies while handling forms (with Database)        NaN
              NaN                                         4.3 Introduction to MySQLi and its data types.        NaN
              NaN                            4.3.1 Creating database, tables, relationships in database.        NaN
              NaN                                            4.3.2 Storing images/files in the database.        NaN
              NaN                                         4.4 MySQLi various supported database engines.        NaN
              NaN                                                                                    NaN        NaN
              NaN                                              Unit 5: Crud operation using OOP with PHP    [8 Hrs]
              NaN                                     5.1 Introduction to database connection functions.        NaN
              NaN             5.2 Various database queries functions: mysqli_query, mysqli_fetch_arary /        NaN
              NaN                         row / object, mysqli_num_rows, mysqli_close, mysqli_select_db,        NaN
              NaN                                                                           mysqli_debug        NaN
              NaN                                     5.3 Implementing CRUD operations with OOP concept.        NaN
              NaN                                             5.4 Error Handling using ‘try’ and ‘catch’        NaN
              NaN                                                                                    NaN        NaN
              NaN                       Unit 6: Introduction to Ajax with PHP, Payment Gateway & Website        NaN
              NaN                                                                 Performance Evaluation    [8 Hrs]
              NaN                                                    6.1 Use of Ajax, it’s pros and cons        NaN
              NaN                                                  6.1.1 Basic function of AJAX with PHP        NaN
              NaN                                  6.1.2 Implementation of AJAX with PHP (with database)        NaN
              NaN                                                           6.2 Payment Gateway Standard        NaN
              NaN                                         6.3 Page Speed and performance related factors        NaN
              NaN                                                                                    NaN        NaN
        Practical                   List of practical will be prepared at the beginning of each semester        NaN
         Text and                            1.  Core PHP Programming; Leon Atkinson; Pearson publishers        NaN
        Reference                            2.  The Complete Reference PHY; Stever Holzner; McGraw Hill        NaN
       Literature               3.  Beginning PHP 5.0 Database; Christopher Scollo, Harish Rawat, Deepak        NaN
              NaN                                                                     Thomas; Wrox Press        NaN
              NaN                                                4.  PHP – A beginner; Ashok Appu; Wiley        NaN
              NaN              5.  PHP 5.0 and MySql Bible; Tim Converse, Joyce Park, Clark Morgan John;        NaN
              NaN                                                                           Wiley & Sons        NaN
              NaN                                      6.  MySQL Bible; Steve Suehring John; Wiley &Sons        NaN
              NaN                                                     7.  PHP Black Book; Peter Moulding        NaN
              NaN                  8.  PHP 5 and Mysql; Tim converse, Joyce Park and Clark Morgan; Bible        NaN
              NaN                                                                                  Wiley        NaN
              NaN                                    9.  Beginning PHP 5.3; Matt Doyle; Wrox Publication        NaN
              NaN                                                                                    NaN        NaN
         Teaching                                 Discussion, Independent Study, Seminars and Assignment        NaN
      Methodology                                       Practical Assignments 80% (Approximately weekly)        NaN
Evaluation Method 50% Internal assessment is based on class attendance, participation, class test, quiz,        NaN
              NaN                                         assignment, seminar, internal examination etc.        NaN
              NaN                            50% assessment is based on end semester written examination        NaN

          Course                                                                            NaN        NaN
Course Objective                                                            To give exposure of        NaN

             NaN                                                    1.1. PL/SQL Block Structure        NaN

             NaN                                      2.1. Concept of cursors, types of cursors        NaN

             NaN                                                  2.2.2. User defined functions        NaN
             NaN                                                                            NaN        NaN

             NaN                                                3.1 Cursors: Implicit, Explicit        NaN

             NaN                                                3.4.1 Triggers and its benefits        NaN
             NaN                             3.4.2 Types of Triggers: Before and After Triggers        NaN

     Purpose of Course   The purpose of the course is to make students understand software engineering process and
                   NaN   capable of applying the principles and techniques of computer science and engineering, to
                   NaN the analysis, design, development, testing, and evaluation of the software and the systems.
      Course Objective                                       To make students understand how to develop software.
                   NaN         To make students understand various components of software process model and their
                   NaN                                                                                    working.
                   NaN                        To make students understand the importance of requirement analysis.
                   NaN                           To make students understand various approaches of system design.
         Pre-requisite                         Basic knowledge of Computer Programming and Application Development
       Course Out come      After completion of this course, the student will be capable of understanding software
                   NaN                   development principles, processes to develop and design software systems.
        Course Content                                         Unit 1: Introduction to Software Engineering[6 Hrs]
                   NaN                                1.1 Software, Software characteristics, Software Engineering
                   NaN                                                           1.2 Software engineering approach
                   NaN                                           1.2.1 Introduction to phased development approach
                   NaN                                                   1.2.2 Introduction to effort distribution
                   NaN                1.3 Software process models - Linear sequential / waterfall model, Prototype
                   NaN                                          model, RAD model, Incremental model, Spiral model.
                   NaN                                              1.4 Various roles and responsibilities in SDLC
                   NaN                                                              1.5 Software quality Assurance
                   NaN                                                            Unit 2: Agile Development[4 Hrs]
                   NaN                                                                2.1Agility and Agile Process
                   NaN                                                                      2.2 Agility principles
                   NaN                                                        2.3 A Tool set for the Agile Process
                   NaN                                             2.4 Agile Development Models - Scrum and sprint
                   NaN                                    Unit 3: Software Requirement Analysis & Modelling[8 Hrs]
                   NaN                                    3.1 Requirement gathering - formal & informal techniques
                   NaN                                                                   3.2 Requirement modelling
                   NaN                                                                    3.2.1 Use case modelling
                   NaN                3.2.2 Classification- Classes, Object relationships, attributes and Methods.
                   NaN                                                                     3.2.3 Data Flow Diagram
                   NaN                                                                     3.3 Class Based Methods
                   NaN                                                       3.3.1 Class Notation-Static Structure
                   NaN                                                                        3.3.2 Object Diagram
                   NaN                                                      3.4 Software Requirement Specification
